column4: I cant get sound, i've tried some ways and i cant get it working, someone helps??
does your s-card show up correctly in the gui ?
no guess, if you call it, you can see it
yes but it says its on pulseaudio
i can see 3 types of alsa
HDA Intel ALC888 Digital (ALSA) , HDA Intel LAC888 Analog (ALSA), ALSA - Advanced Linux Sound Architecture
but when i run it it says something wrong with the permissions (when installing)
but i get error installing (coz of permission), an alsa update (to latest versio)
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded
.. w00ttt.. now i cant get alsamixer cmd working.. "alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such device"
alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such device
with  sudo lshw | pastebinit, i get - Error no arguments specified!
i get the no driver error
maybe i must try reinstalling, how?
though it should be already : sudo apt-get install alsa-utils alsa-base alsa-oss
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
why i cant change/move the level of the headset sound?, and its all the way down
thanks ^^ lol but im trying with music and still nosound =s
the headset level cant edit it
nosound at all, yes on the green one, in XP it works fine
now im trying with some youtube vids
i dont play it with amarok, should i?
i tried with alsaplayer, totem and vlc
the Headphone volume is all the way down and cant move it how can i fix that?
it might be you got to re-install alsamixer, as alsa couldn't find the card before an chip is now correctly found
maybe.. i've tried so many different things i dont know what to do now
have you got sound on the regular output ?
no, i've never heard anything on this OS
sudo apt-get remove --purge alsamixergui alsa-utils alsa-oss alsa-base
sudo apt-get install alsamixergui alsa-utils alsa-oss alsa-base
for usual, a desktop has three audio jacks : line, mic and out at the back and maybe a front panel connected to the board
yea i know, but i think that the headset is good when its plugged
so is there a separate headphone or do you use the standard out ?
in alsamixer above the volume sliders the speaker icons have to bee green (clickable)
yes its green, and all the way up
no:s, i've tried all the types in the list
it doesnt response to that cmd
nothing, it seems like its processing the info but i get no response
yes, now i realize that its too big, let me try again
no errors in snd, if playback works correctly, should have sound, try something different :
kk arround 20 mins, you will be here?
its coz im in a network (4 pcs downloading)
so no further idea then, maybe play around with the preferences, you should have sound
